Pasarán las décadas y seguirá siendo leyenda inmortal de la industria del videojuego. Half-Life es un Shotter en primera persona que nos pone en los zapatos de Gordon Freeman, un científico de Black Mesa trabajando con un material radioactivo recientemente descubierto, el cual, al ser altamente inestable, provoca una fisura dimensional en la que unos alienígenas provenientes de Xen (un plano existencial que conecta 2 o más dimensiones) infesten los laboratorios de Black Mesa. Deberás hacerte camino entre las diferentes abominaciones de Xen, los militares (cuya misión es no dejar constancia de este incidente), trampas y peligros del entorno (como fosas de ácido o aguas infestadas de parásitos).

El juego cuenta con varias expansiones e incluso una secuela con más expansiones. Lástima que nunca veremos cómo acaba la historia...

Nota personal: (8/10)

Das beste Spiel welches Valve je auf den Markt gebracht hat. Schade, dass es ihnen heute nur noch um Geld geht...

[h1][b][u]The Short Version:[/u][/b][/h1]

[i][b]TL;DR: [/b]This game has a great singleplayer experience, an even better multiplayer experience with laser-canon assisted flying, bunnyhopping, longjumping, a diverse arsenal and the ability to combo all of your weapons into each other.[/i]


[h1][b][u]The Long Version:[/u][/b][/h1]

I came for the singleplayer, then stayed for the multiplayer. This game has three strong points:

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]

Half-Life 1 objectively has [b]one of the best[/b] multiplayer experiences in the entire Steam store. Playing multiplayer is a very unique experience for many reasons...

First is the community servers. There is no matchmaking like we have nowadays. This means you see recurring players, and unlike in matchmaking systems you get the opportunity to make friends (shout-out to the OAK server)

Second is the weapon selection. Every weapon is good for different situations, and it allows people to develop unique play-styles. As you learn what weapons are good for when, you'll see your scores improve and you'll start winning more matches. Then when you've mastered all the weapons you start to realize you can sort of combo certain weapons together. 

It's a very no-mercy type of multiplayer. At first, you will get beaten and battered simply because there is no tutorial or guide and its combat is complex (and if the map is Crossfire you're going to constantly get obliterated by someone shooting a laser canon through a wall). You join a server in the midst of an all out free-for-all war and you're left to figure out how to fight for your life or lose trying. If you're not willing to put some effort into learning new skills to git gud at a game, consider playing Valve's other multiplayer games. If you are however, soon [b]you[/b] will be the one obliterating people through walls with a laser canon.

[h1]Singleplayer[/h1]

It's story is not over-bearing like normal games these days, it's just enough to host the gameplay and keep you en route and not too potent that it gets in the way or takes control away from the player. The game only stops you to give you direction and tell you what you're trying to achieve in the story. It never takes control away from you, all of Gordon's actions are yours. [b]It's all you.[/b] The game lets the events play out around you while you're still able to move and look for yourself. It makes you feel like YOU were the one responsible for the destruction of Black Mesa, like you are dealing with the unforeseen consequences. It sets you up to feel like a badass.

As for functionality, the age of the engine will guarantee you a high framerate and you can uncap it (fps_max 999) for super low latency and ultra smoothness. This makes movement fun and maximizes control and comfort with your character.

In the end, I love this game and all but I can't say most people would enjoy it simply because of the looks and 90s jank. Lets be real, HL1 looks gross next to something like Doom 2016. However even if you can't get past that stuff, there is "Black Mesa", a HL1 remake in Source 2 that looks beautiful and functions great. It's the same game with mostly the same levels, but it utilizes technology that wasn't available in 1998 and makes the game look sexy. 


[h1]Speedrunning[/h1]

There's not much to say about this. Everything about this game makes it perfect for speedrunning with the exception of the latest version capping your speed (so we use GoldSrc Package for pre-Steam physics). This is hands down one of the best game out there in terms of movement heavy speed games.

Half-Life I had no idea what I was missing till I played it. Through the whole game I was engaded with the charecters and enviroment. I ended up playing the game all day long eventualy finishing it in one sitting. Most importantly it has made me want to revisit it and play again and thats what I plan on doing. True gaming masterpiece. Its a MUST PLAY!

Já estava a muito tempo querendo jogar Half Life pra valer, mas sempre deixava pra comprar depois, até que um dia acabei comprando o resto do pacote da valve que me faltava e lá estava ele, fui jogar só para dar uma nostalgia mas acabei viciando e zerando bem rápido, me surpreendi com a qualidade do jogo e entendi bem porque HL tem tantos fãs. 

O jogo é divertido, desafiador, muito dinâmico, possui gráficos bem agradáveis para jogar, a história é interessante mesmo não sendo profunda, as possibilidades de armas são vastas, a diversidade de inimigos é desafiadora e a ultima fase é bem "Dark Souls". Se você está indeciso como eu estava antes de comprar, se acha que não vai gostar pelo jogo ser antigo ou algo do tipo, pode comprar sem medo, você não vai se arrepender.
O pai de todos FPS, com uma gameplay e mecanicas revolucionarias para época, além de um enredo envolvente
me recuerda mucho la infancia,grandisimo juego,lo recomiendo al 100 para pasar un rato matando atus amigos xd
exelent, i mean the greatest game of all time ever

Sevgili Valve sence de yetmedi mi bu kadar beklemek evet oyunun senaryosu sızdı, epistle 3 çıktı ama zaten bu kadar geç kalınması hataydı nerde Adrian Shephard, nerde o hikayeyi Portal'a bağlama (borealis dışında) nerde bizim G-abimiz

Best Game Ever.

This was not a retroactive review for me. The first time I played this game was just a few months ago. Its everything that it was always held up to be. There are a couple non intuitive buttons to press, but that is the extent of the issues. Fun, diverse levels and enemies. Its engaging in its lack of story, by which I mean you have to pick things up through passing dialogue, and there is a lot of time spent wondering what is going on. 
There are lots of games that don't age well because of graphics issues, and sure there is some of that here, but its minimal. The more important aging issue as far as games are concerned is: is it fun to play now, in the era of COD WWII and all that crap. I say a resounding yes.
It was this time, when the only FreeMan picked up his crowbar and started a legacy, a revolution, a cult, destroying and creating at the same time.

This game is still absolutely amazing.

Black Mesa (remake of Half-Life) is good, but Half-Life is still the best.

Klasyk roku 1998.
Polecam każdemu fanowi gier typu FPS.

En su momento lo jugue y lo termine, me parecio (y aun lo sigue siendo) uno de los mejores juegos que pude disfrutar en mi vida, y un dia decidi darle una prueba a steam con sus "famosos descuentos" y para mi alegria pude volverlo a comprar junto con el resto, y cuando tengo un momemto libre vuelvo a disfrutar de esta gran aventura y sobre todo sus complementos (blue-shift y Opposing force). Si tienen el dinero y no tenes estas verdaderas JOYAS no dudes en comprarlos, estos son parte de la historia de los videojuegos y sobre todo han definido un camino a seguir para el resto.

An old classic that set the standard for so many current FPS games. So many game design features have been copied and are still being used: Level design, progression, basic FPS movements, story chapters with their own feel of environment, inventory, health & armour mechanics.

Its graphics are obviously old now, but still fun to go through for old time's sake.
